sen.j: 相馬 義胤（そうま よしたね、生没年不詳）は鎌倉時代の武士。
sen.e: Yoshitane SOMA (year of birth and death unknown) was a samurai, who lived during the Kamakura period.
Yoshitane SOMA (year of birth and death unknown) was a samurai who lived during the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: "who"前のカンマは、特に必要ないので、削除しました。
sen.e: Yoshitane SOMA (year of birth and death unknown) was a samurai who lived during the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 千葉氏の庶流相馬氏二代当主。
sen.e: He was the second family head of 千葉氏の庶流 a branch descended from the Chiba clan.
He was the second head of the Soma clan, a branch family of the Chiba clan.
sen.cmt: "the"と"second"の間のスペースを1つ削除しました。千葉氏の庶流相馬氏→the Soma clan, a branch family of the Chiba clan
sen.e: He was the second head of the Soma clan, a branch family of the Chiba clan.
He was the son of Morotsune SOMA.
He was the son of Morotsune SOMA.
He was the son of Morotsune SOMA.

sen.j: 相馬胤綱、女子（岩松時兼妻）の父（異説あり）。
sen.e: He was the father of Tanetsuna SOMA and a daughter (Tokikane IWAMATSU's wife) (there is a different opinion).
He was the father of Tanetsuna SOMA and a daughter (Tokikane IWAMATSU's wife) (there is a different opinion).
He was the father of Tanetsuna SOMA and a daughter (Tokikane IWAMATSU's wife) (there is a different opinion).
Goro
He was also called Goro.
sen.cmt: 主語・動詞を補いました。
sen.e: He was also called Goro.
Hyoe (palace guard)
He held the office of palace guard.
sen.cmt: 主語・動詞を補いました。兵衛→palace guard
sen.e: He held the office of palace guard.
Another name was Yoshitane.
Yoshitane can be written as either '義胤' or '能胤' in Japanese.
sen.cmt: 「別名」の意味となるように変更しました。
sen.e: Yoshitane can be written as either '義胤' or '能胤' in Japanese.

sen.j: 1201年、父の師常が隠居したために家督を継ぐ。
sen.e: In 1201, he took over the family reign, after his father Morotsune went into retirement.
In 1201, he took over the head of the family because his father, Morotsune, retired.
sen.cmt: 家督を継ぐ→take over the head of the familyために→because（理由を示しているので、"after"を変更しました。）隠居する→retire
sen.e: In 1201, he took over the head of the family because his father, Morotsune, retired.

sen.j: 1204年、畠山重忠事件が起こると、重忠と縁戚関係（義胤の祖母は重忠の叔母）であったにも関わらず、北条義時に与して重忠を討った。
sen.e: In 1204, when the Incident of Shigetada HATAKEYAMA occurred, even though he had a blood relationship with Shigetada (Yoshitane's grandmother was Yoshitada's aunt), he supported Yoshitoki HOJO and defeated Shigetada.
sen.cmt: 畠山重忠事件→the Incident of Shigetada HATAKEYAMAとしました。縁戚関係→blood relationshipとしました。
sen.e: In 1204, when the Incident of Shigetada HATAKEYAMA occurred, Yoshitane supported Yoshitoki HOJO and defeated Shigetada even though he had a blood relationship with Shigetada (Yoshitane's grandmother was Shigetada's aunt).
sen.cmt: 重忠の叔母→Shigetada's aunt（Yoshitada's auntと誤記されていたので、訂正しました。）英語らしい表現にするため、原文通りの語順で訳し下げず、理由となる「重忠と～関わらず」の部分を最後に置きました。
sen.e: In 1204, when the Incident of Shigetada HATAKEYAMA occurred, Yoshitane supported Yoshitoki HOJO and defeated Shigetada even though he had a blood relationship with Shigetada (Yoshitane's grandmother was Shigetada's aunt).

sen.j: この功により、陸奥国の一部（高城保）を地頭職として任されている。
sen.e: For this service, he was appointed as Jito shiki (manager and lord of a private estate) to control a part (Takakiho) of Mutsu Province.
Due to this service, he was trusted to control part (Takakiho) of Mutsu Province as Jito shiki (manager and lord of a private estate).
sen.cmt: ～により→due to（理由を示すので、due toに変更しました。）任される→trusted
sen.e: Due to this service, he was trusted to control part (Takakiho) of Mutsu Province as Jito shiki (manager and lord of a private estate).

sen.j: 1221年、承久の乱が起こると子の胤綱と共に（孫の相馬胤継もいたとも）幕府軍として参陣して、宇治川の戦いや近江国瀬田橋の戦いで活躍して、軍功を挙げた。
sen.e: In 1221, when the Jokyu War broke out, he took part in the army of bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) with his son Tanetsuna (according to a theory, his grandson Tanetsugu SOMA also participated), and he fought actively in the Battle of Uji-gawa River and the Battle of Seta (no Karahashi) Bridge in Omi Province to render distinguished military service.
sen.cmt: 瀬田橋の戦い→the Battle of Seta (no Karahashi) Brideとしました（通常は「瀬田の戦い」（「橋」が入らない）あるいは「瀬田の唐橋の戦い」（「唐橋」を加える）と言う表記のようです）。
sen.e: In 1221, when the Jokyu War broke out, Yoshitane who joined the War with his son, Tanetsuna (it is said that his grandson, Tanetsugu SOMA, also joined), as the army of bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) played an active role in the Battle of Uji-gawa River and the Battle of Seta (no Karahashi) Bridge in Omi Province and rendered distinguished military service.
sen.cmt: 参陣する→join the war簡潔にするため、関係代名詞を使用し、そのため、主語を"he"ではなく、"Yoshitane"としました。
sen.e: In 1221, when the Jokyu War broke out, Yoshitane who joined the War with his son, Tanetsuna (it is said that his grandson, Tanetsugu SOMA, also joined), as the army of bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) played an active role in the Battle of Uji-gawa River and the Battle of Seta (no Karahashi) Bridge in Omi Province and rendered distinguished military service.

sen.j: その後も御家人として幕府に忠実に仕え、越後国、大和国にも所領を得ていた。
sen.e: After the war, he continued serving the bakufu faithfully as gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods), and he was granted territories in Echigo Province and Yamato Province, as well.

Even after the War, he continued serving in the bakufu faithfully as gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods), and was granted territories in also Echigo Province and Yamato Province.
sen.cmt: その後も→even after the War（この場合、"war"は、上記の承久の乱を指すので、大文字にて表記し、"も"を表すため、"even after"としました。）
sen.e: Even after the War, he continued serving in the bakufu faithfully as gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods), and was granted territories in also Echigo Province and Yamato Province.
